subject: Re: [junit] Question about running tests
msgSnippet: ... Try something like: TestResult result = new TestResult(); new MyTestCase( testXXX ).run(result); result.countFailures() .countErrors() etc. Johannes
messageBody:
Joseph Toussaint wrote:
>
> I have a object which extends TestCase and works if I run the
> junit.textui.TestRunner - but I'd like to run it from inside a java class
> and get back the statistics - such as failure, success, and runtime. Is
> there any way I can do this or am I fighting a loosing battle?
>
> thanks
>

Try something like:
TestResult result = new TestResult();
new MyTestCase("testXXX").run(result);
result.countFailures()
.countErrors()
etc.

Johannes
